scene-title: Main Proof of the Pythagorean Theorem
scene-visual: Animation of a square with a right-angled triangle inside it
scene-narration: Consider a square with side length a + b. We can divide this square into a smaller square of side length c and four right-angled triangles. The area of the larger square is (a+b)², which equals a² + 2ab + b². The combined area of the smaller square and the triangles is c² + 2ab. Equating these two gives us a² + b² = c², which is the Pythagorean theorem.
